fields.text: Index VCA Sub-population Screening Form
fields.toaster_info_text:
The Index VCA Screening Form will be used to assess the VCA Sub Population to determine whether s/he should be enrolled into the OVC Comprehensive program. 

 The data collected on this tool are used to ensure that the criteria set for enrolling the VCA Sub Populations is followed and that it is consistent and only the target sub-populations are enrolled into the program. The data will form the basis for enrolling an individual into the program.

fields.text: Administrative Information

fields.label: VCA Gender

fields.text: Socio-Demographic Information

fields.label: Is the VCA in School?

fields.text: Children/Adolescents Living with HIV (C/ALHIV)

fields.label: Is the Child/Adolescent HIV Positive
Is the Child/Adolescent currently on HIV treatment?
Does the Child/Adolescent have their viral load test results on file?
Does the Child/Adolescent have their TB screening results on file?
Was the client screened for TB during the last clinical visit?
What was the screening result
Was client initiated for TB Preventive Therapy (TPT)?
Was the client initiated on TB Preventive Therapy (TPT)?
Has the child/adolescent been screened for malnutrition?
Does the child/adolescent receive drugs to prevent other illnesses (cotrimoxazole prophylaxis)?
Is the Child in the 0-2 years age group? (If no, screen for other sub populations).

fields.text: HIV Exposed Infant (HEI)

fields.label: Was the child born from a mother who is HIV Positive?
Is the mother currently on HIV treatment?
Is the mother adhering to treatment?
Is the mother virally suppressed?

fields.hint: Has the child been tested for HIV?

fields.label: Is the child receiving breast feeding?
Has the child been tested for HIV in line with the guidelines?
Does the child/adolescent receive drugs to prevent HIV and other illnesses? (ARVs/cotrimoxazole prophylaxis)?
Has the child (6 months and above) been screened for malnutrition?
Does the child/adolescent get drugs to prevent Tuberculosis (TB Preventive Therapy (TPT))?
Is the child enrolled in an Early Childhood Development Program?

fields.text: Children of Women Living with HIV (C/WLHIV)

fields.label: Is the Child/Adolescent a biological child of a mother living with HIV?
Has the Child/Adolescent been tested for HIV/Index testing with mother as index client?
Is the mother currently on HIV treatment?
Is the mother adhering to treatment?
Is the mother virally suppressed?
Is the Child/Adolescent receiving any HIV and violence prevention intervention?

fields.text: At Risk Adolescent Girls and Young Women (AGYW)

fields.label: Is the AGYW sexually active?
Is AGYW using any of these HIV/pregnancy prevention methods?
Is the AGYW having sex with older men?
Is the AGYW engaged in transactional sex?
Is the AGYW engaged in transactional sex?
Is the AGYW engaged in sex work?
Is the AGYW food or economically insecure?
Did the AGYW marry early (child marriage)?
Did the AGYW give birth before the age of 18 (teen mum)?
Does the AGYW have a partner who is violent or has experienced violence?
Has the AGYW ever been diagnosed with a Sexually Transmitted Illness (STI)?
Is the AGYW receiving an economic strengthening intervention?

fields.text: Children/Adolescents who are Survivors of Sexual Violence

fields.label: Has the child/adolescent ever experienced sexual violence?
Is the child/adolescent still living in the same household as the perpetrator?
Was the child/adolescent supported to seek justice
Did the child/adolescent access clinical care?
Did the child/adolescent receive any of these clinical care services?

options.text: Non of the clinical care services

fields.label: Is the child/adolescentâ€™s caregiver an FSW?
Has the child/adolescent been tested for HIV?
Was the HIV test result positive?
Is the Child/Adolescent receiving any age-appropriate HIV and sexual violence prevention intervention?
Is the Adolescent and caregiver receiving any economic strengthening intervention?

fields.text:
â€œThe goal of the USAID ECAP II OVC Comprehensive Program is to mitigate the impact of HIV and improve the health and well-being of VCA through delivery of high-impact, evidence-informed, and age-appropriate interventions customized for each vulnerable child and adolescent sub-population. 
 For the children and adolescents living with HIV, the program aims to support households and children living with HIV to ensure that they access appropriate care services to improve treatment outcome and sustain viral load suppression. 

 If you consent to participate in the program, it entails that you will officially be:

â€¢ Enrolled in the USAID ECAP II Program
â€¢  Assigned a Case Worker who will visit your household frequently to support you and your family to achieve your health and socioeconomic goals
â€¢  Exited from the program when deemed to have achieved graduation status. 

If you have questions about this program or have any questions on what your rights are as a participant in this program, you can contact the PCZ Executive Director/Chief of Party: 

PCZ Executive Director/Chief of Party
Project Concern Zambia
P.O Box 32320 Lusaka-Zambia
Phone #: +2609777771385/95
fields.toaster_info_text: This is an information note, This is an information note, This is an information note, This is an information note,This is an information note, This is an information note

fields.text:
This informed consent form is targeted at vulnerable Children and Adolescents (VCA) and their primary caregivers who are identified as eligible clients for enrollment in the USAID ECAP II OVC Comprehensive Program. 

 The purpose of the consent form is to explain the USAID ECAP II program to the potential client before the client agrees to it. This will enable the client to ask questions and accept or deny participation in the program. 


The process of the informed consent includes : 

â€¢ The clientâ€™s ability to decide. 
â€¢ Explanation of information needed to make the decision. 
â€¢ The clientâ€™s understanding of services provided under the USAID ECAP II Program 
â€¢ The clientâ€™s voluntary decision to be enrolled in the USAID ECAP II OVC Comprehensive Program 

 This shared decision-making process between the client and service providers attached to the USAID ECAP II Program will empower the client to make educated and informed decisions about their care.
